headline.main: Science Watch; Moons of Jupiter and Saturn Thinness Can Harm Health Controlling Blood Pressure

docs.abstract: Study conducted by Dr Jeremiah Stamler and his colleagues at Northwestern University Medical School and Chicago Health Research Foundation on some 200 men who had mild high blood pressure or were prone to developing it indicates that disorder can be averted by lasting improvements in eating and exercise habits without having to resort to drug therapy; findings are described in May 9 issue of Journal of the American Medical Assn (S)
